snippet: An Afghan family’s official complaint about the rape of an 18-year-old girl is a test of the government’s willingness to challenge armed militias.
abstract: Lal Bibi, 18-year old rape victim in Afghanistan, has taken the rare step of coming forward to publicly accuse the local militiamen who assaulted her; case stretches the bounds of conservative Afghan tribal tradition and amounts to a test of the government's willingness to challenge the impunity of the many armed groups operating in the country.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Kunduz, Afghanistan, and Habib Zahori from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: An Afghan family’s official complaint about the rape of an 18-year-old girl is a test of the government’s willingness to challenge armed militias.

headline.seo: Afghan Rape Case Is a Challenge for the Government
headline.main: Rape Case, in Public, Cites Abuse by Armed Groups in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Rape Case, in Public, Cites Abuse By Armed Groups in Afghanistan
